question_text: The PURA scheme by the former President Dr. Abdul Kalam refers to:
option_1_text: Providing Urban Amenities in Rural Areas
option_2_text: A Plan for Urban and Rural Areas
option_3_text: A model for the growth of the metro Cities
answer_explanation_text:
Providing Urban Amenities in Rural Areas (PURA) is a scheme envisioned by former President Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam.
The scheme aims to bridge the rural-urban divide by providing essential urban amenities and services to rural areas.
PURA focuses on improving the quality of life in rural areas by ensuring the provision of physical, electronic, and knowledge connectivity.
The initiative includes infrastructure development such as roads, water supply, sanitation, and electricity, as well as social infrastructure like schools and healthcare facilities.
By fostering economic activities and enhancing livelihood opportunities, PURA aims to curb rural-to-urban migration and promote sustainable development in rural areas.

question_text: When was the first ever National Agriculture Policy announced?
answer_explanation_text:
The first ever National Agriculture Policy in India was announced on July 2000.
The policy aimed at achieving a growth rate of over 4% per annum in the agriculture sector.
It focused on sustainable agriculture, food and nutritional security, generation and transfer of technology, and better management of natural resources.
The policy emphasized the importance of private sector participation and aimed at creating a favorable economic environment for increasing capital formation and farmer's income.

question_text: What does M stand for in MUDRA yojana?
answer_explanation_text:
Micro stands for micro enterprises, which are the primary focus of the MUDRA (Micro Units Development and Refinance Agency) Yojana.
MUDRA Yojana was launched by the Government of India to provide funding to the non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises.
The scheme aims to support the growth and development of micro-enterprises in India by providing financial assistance up to Rs. 10 lakh.
MUDRA loans are categorized into three products: Shishu (covering loans up to Rs. 50,000), Kishor (covering loans above Rs. 50,000 and up to Rs. 5 lakh), and Tarun (covering loans above Rs. 5 lakh and up to Rs. 10 lakh).
The initiative is aimed at promoting entrepreneurship and employment generation at the grassroots level.

question_text: What is the maximum age of a girl eligible for opening an account in Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana?
answer_explanation_text:
Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana is a savings scheme launched by the government of India.
The scheme was launched in 2015.
It was launched by prime minister Narendra Modi.
Under this scheme, a special deposit account can be opened for girl children in her name by her parents in any post office or authorized branches of commercial banks.
The maximum age of a girl eligible for opening an account in Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana is 10 years.
The initial deposit required to open an account is Rs 250(initially which was Rs.1000).
The maximum deposit limit under this scheme is Rs 150,000.
Only two girl children from a family will get the benefit of Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana.

question_text: Which among the following is a scheme that is aimed at the development of girl child in the country?
answer_explanation_text:
The correct answer is Pradhan Mantri Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana.

Pradhan Mantri Sukanya Samriddhi Scheme is aimed at the security of girl child in the country.
It was launched on 22 January 2015.
The parents of the girl child can open the account before she attains the age of 10 years and deposit money till the child becomes 14 years old.
After the age of 21 years, the amount can be withdrawn by the girl child.
The minimum amount required to be deposited in this account every year is Rs 250 whereas the maximum investment in a year can be up to Rs 1.5 lakhs.

question_text: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala yojna is related to :
answer_explanation_text:
Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala yojna:

The PMUY was launched on May 1st, 2016 in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh.
It was to provide a free LPG connection to women belonging to BPL.
It is one of the best ways to create smokeless cooking and to make women's life healthy.

question_text: PM Gram Sadak Yojana was started in Uttar Pradesh in the year  _______
answer_explanation_text:
PM Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY) was started in Uttar Pradesh in the year 2012.
PM Gram Sadak Yojana was introduced in 2000 by the then-Prime Minister of India Late Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee.
Mukhya Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana run by various state governments are the schemes that complement PMGSY The aim was to provide roads to all villages with a population of 1000 persons and above by 2003.
The aim was also to provide roads to all villages with a population of 500 persons and above by 2007.
Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act was passed on September 7, 2005, but it came into force on February 2, 2006.

question_text: <q>Handmade Paper</q> is selected as a product from the ______ district of Uttar Pradesh under the <q>One district One Product</q> scheme.
answer_explanation_text:
One District, One Product Programme aims to encourage indigenous and specialized products and crafts in India.
It was first started by the Uttar Pradesh government.
This scheme will provide job opportunities to 25 lakh unemployed candidates across the state.
Improvement in product quality and skill development is one of the main objective of the One District, One Product Programme.
Uttar Pradesh government had launched this scheme on 24 January 2018.
Handmade Paper is selected as a product from the Jalaun district of Uttar Pradesh under the One District One Product scheme.

question_text: The Mid-Day Meal scheme comes under the purview of which ministry?
option_2_text: Ministry of Women and Child Development
option_3_text: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
option_4_text: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
answer_explanation_text:
Mid-day Meal Scheme was started in 1995 throughout India by the Ministry of Education.
Mid-day Meal Scheme is a school meal program of the Government of India.
The Midday Meal Scheme is now covered under the National Food Security Act, 2013.
Objectives of the Mid Day Meal Scheme:
    Boost student enrolment.
    It helps to promote students' attendance.
    Serves as an incentive not only for the children but also for the parents as it has an implicit subsidy.
    The attraction for children who are otherwise reluctant to go to school.

question_text: Which state launched the SAHAY scheme aimed at nurturing young sporting talents in Maoist-hit districts, in December 2021?
answer_explanation_text:
Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren launched a scheme aimed at nurturing young sporting talents in Maoist-hit districts, in December 2021.
The scheme is called Sports Action toward Harnessing Aspiration of Youth (SAHAY).Boys and girls in the 14-19 age group from villages to ward level will be registered under the scheme and given opportunities to display their skills in basketball, volleyball, etc.

question_text: Which of the following ministry has launched <q>Bhasha Certificate Selfie</q> campaign to encourage cultural diversity and promote multilingualism?
answer_explanation_text:
Ministry of Education launched a campaign Bhasha Certificate Selfie to encourage cultural diversity and promote multilingualism and foster the spirit of Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat.
The initiative aims to promote the Bhasha Sangam mobile app, developed by the Ministry of Education and MyGov India.
Bhasha Sangam mobile app was launched by the Minister of Education and Skill Development.

question_text: <q>Udey Desh ka Aam Nagrik</q> (UDAN) scheme for regional air connectivity will provide travel to tier 2 and tier 3 cities at the rate of Rs ________ per hour.
answer_explanation_text: Under the UDAN Scheme people travelling to tier 2 and tier 3 cities will have to pay Rs 2500 per hour. The objective of UDAN is aimed at making air travel affordable and widespread, to boost inclusive national economic development and air transport infrastructure development of all regions and states of India.

question_text: The government will hand how many monuments to the private sector for their upkeep under the Monument Mitra Scheme, announced by the Ministry of Culture in January 2023?
answer_explanation_text:
The Ministry of Tourism has transferred the scheme to the Ministry of Culture.
The government has set the target to hand over 500 sites under the revamped Monument Mitra Scheme by the end of Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav on 15 August 2023.
Corporate entities will take over these monuments as part of their Corporate Social Responsibility.
Under the scheme, monument amenities will be revamped by the private sector.
The scheme will help India in showcasing the best of its culture and tradition to all the senior dignitaries and VVIPs coming to the country from all across the world.
The government is also preparing a digital museum, on a G20 Orchestra, on a book of poems, on exhibitions to bring the 5000 years old Indian culture in front of G20 delegates.

question_text: On which occasion PM Narendra Modi has announced a new PM-SHRI scheme?
answer_explanation_text:
On the occasion of Teachers' Day (5 September 2022), PM Modi announced a new initiative Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) Yojana.
Under this scheme 14,500 schools across the country are upgraded and developed.
At least one PM Shri School will be established in every block of the country.
The PM SHRI Schools will showcase all components of the National Education Policy 2020.

question_text: Which state launched the Free Smartphone Yojana in December 2021?
answer_explanation_text:
The UP government launched the Free Smartphone Yojana on December 25, 2021.
Under the scheme the state government will distribute smartphones and tablets to final year students of graduation and above.
In phase I of the scheme around one lakh smartphones and tablets will be given to final year students of B.Tech, B.A, B.Sc, MA, ITI, MBBS, MD, M.Tech, Ph.D. in Lucknow.

question_text: The Chief Minister of which state launched the <q>Duare Ration</q> (ration at doorstep) scheme in November 2021?
answer_explanation_text:
West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee launched the Duare Ration (ration at doorstep) scheme on 16 November 2021.
It will benefit around 10 crore people of the state.
She also inaugurated a WhatsApp chatbot for the Food and Supplies Department of the state government and a mobile application, Khadya Sathi: Amar Ration Mobile App to help people apply for ration cards.

question_text: What is the name of India's first fashion forecasting initiative launched by Union Minister of Textiles, Shri Giriraj Singh, in 2024?
answer_explanation_text:
VisioNxt is India's first fashion trend forecasting initiative launched by NIFT with support from the Ministry of Textiles.
The initiative uses a combination of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Emotional Intelligence (EI) to provide trend insights.
It aims to reduce India's dependence on global trend forecasting agencies by offering India-specific fashion trends.
VisioNxt's AI-based model, DeepVision, helps predict fashion trends by analyzing apparel attributes like style, color, and patterns.

question_text: Which initiative, recently launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, aims to construct approximately 24,800 rainwater harvesting structures across Gujarat?
answer_explanation_text:
The Prime Minister highlighted the importance of public participation in water conservation efforts to ensure a sustainable future for upcoming generations.
He noted that water conservation reflects our values and will be a key measure of our legacy for future generations.
Modi referenced previous government initiatives such as the Jal Jivan Mission and Atal Bhujal Yojana, and stressed the need for adopting innovative technologies to address water scarcity.
The initiative aims to build around 24,800 rainwater harvesting structures across Gujarat to improve water conservation.
Union Minister of Jal Shakti CR Patil and Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel were present at the launch event.

question_text:
Which of the following were the main features of the economic relief package announced by the Finance Minister in March 2020?

A. Insurance cover of Rs 30 lakh per person for doctors and medical workers fighting COVID-19.
B. Increase in MGNREGA wage to Rs 202 a day from Rs 182 for 13.62 crore families.

Select the correct answer
answer_explanation_text: Explanation: Some of the main features of the economic relief package announced by the Finance Minister in March 2020 are insurance cover of Rs 30 lakh per person for doctors and medical workers fighting COVID-19 and an increase in MGNREGA wage to Rs 202 a day from Rs 182 for 13.62 crore families.

question_text: <b>Which of the following are the benefits of the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package?
option_1_text: An insurance cover of Rs 50 Lakh
option_2_text: Free LPG Cylinders to the BPL families for one month
option_3_text: Free Pulses for the next three months under PM Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana
option_4_text: Both A and C are correct
answer_explanation_text: Explanation: Under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (PMGKY), any health worker in government hospitals and healthcare centres who is working in the treatment of COVID-19 patients would be provided with an insurance cover of Rs 50 Lakh if met with some accident. To the BPL families, for the next three months, free LPG cylinders will be provided under the Ujjwala Yojana. And under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana, 5 kg wheat or rice and 1 kg of preferred pulses will be provided for the next three months.
